conclusion: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, calculated from the slope of the velocity-time graph.
At t = 1 second, the velocity v1 = 2 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity v2 = -2 m/s.
The time interval is from t = 1 to t = 3 seconds, so Δt = 2 seconds.
The change in velocity Δv = v2 - v1 = -2 - 2 = -4 m/s.
The acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is -2 m/s².
